thread.title: TV | Jack the Ripper: The Missing Evidence
thread.title_full: TV | Jack the Ripper: The Missing Evidence - entertainment.ie

author: Fiona Flynn
title: TV | Jack the Ripper: The Missing Evidence
text: Jack the Ripper is one of history's most notorious serial killers with many theorising over his identity down the years since the three-month period in 1888 when a number of women were murdered on the streets of Whitechapel. Journalist Christer Holmgren believes that he has found a suspect who can not only be linked directly to one of the murders, but also whose daily routine could be consistent with all the other deaths. Having studied the case for more than three decades, his focus eventually fell on a witness called Charles Cross, whose real name turned out to be Charles Allen Lechmere, which led him to a mass of incriminating evidence.
